artist: Bob Fried; Publisher: Family Dog Productions, San Francisco
creditline: Gift of Paul Maurer and Scott West
image_copyright: © Chet Helms DBA Family Dog Productions. All Rights Reserved
provenance: Paul Maurer, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2019.
text: Robert Fried’s “Sky Web” concert poster repurposes a widely published image of an experimental hang glider flown by German aviation pioneer Otto Lilienthal (1848-1896), whose bird-like glider designs of the 1890s were important precursors to mechanical flight. In this surreal, dream-like landscape, the daredevil aviator crosses a brilliant yellow sun set high in an orange sky. He is enveloped by a radiating web of curved lines that stretch outward to convey a sense of infinite dimensional space and the plasticity of time, qualities that Fried experienced while using the hallucinogenic drug LSD. Nearly indecipherable orange text is emblazoned across the rolling blue-green hills bearing the names of the performers, the concert dates, and the venue details.
title: Sky Web, The Charlatans, Buddy Guy, September 22-24, Avalon Ballroom
